page.title: 15Housing in NW Derby, part 2
page.content: In 1985 public sector developments have practically ceased, due to lack of funds, although the Council does provide sheltered schemes for the eld- erly. The recently formed Housing Association builds for those people with limited cash, filling a slot bet- ween the private and public sector. The figures for new building in the 1980's are: private sector 93%, public sector 4.5%, Housing Association 2.5%. Darley Abbey, Little Chester, Friar- gate and Markeaton are Conservation Areas where houses of historic or architectural interest are protected. In 1980 the tenure figures for the wards of Darley, Mackworth & Abbey were: owner occupied 6647, council houses 4326, Housing Assn. 472, other rented accommodation 1643. By 1985, 1250 council houses in Mackworth had been sold to tenants.
